intro: Amsinckia cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf globe mallows, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and spherical, woolly seed pods that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding visual interest to its habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky areas. Amsinckia cinerea is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
